caption: Nice place, a bit expensive but it's normal in these places. Super well located and good coffee.

I took a healthy and tasty chicken bowl for me and two artisanal chips for the kids. The Location is very nice.  The two stars for service are under request of my kid that went back to ask for salt to add to the chips and says he was mocked for his Italian accent when asking in French

The Petit Plisson located next The Jardin Des Tuileries . There are not too many options for meals but if you are tired and need a break in the middle of the park, this is one of the close & good options for a light meal . the Jardin des Tuileries is a beautiful public park in Paris that is definitely worth a visit. The park features stunning gardens, fountains, and sculptures, as well as several cafes and food stands where visitors can enjoy refreshments while taking in the scenery.
KIND STAFF, GOOD HOT DOG. But PRICY and really LITTLE SUPPLY of FOOD. At 1pm already finished all the hot dog.
Rudest seller ive ever seen, we asked to split the bill but on purpose he did not. Awful customer service
Very tasty food and quick service, beautiful scenery

Really nice sitting area inside the gardens. Umbrellas provide such a relief during warm sunny days. It was a good experience to sit and sip the chilled White wine here. The overall vibes are really good. There is a small pond right next to it.
Hands down the worst cappuccino I've ever had. One sip and straight in the bin. Instant coffee would have tasted better than that
First problem is the waiting time just to order. Then, communication issues in a tourist place (you need to talk English)  Then...majority of the products are not available and food is precooked.

Large terrace in the middle of the gardens, partially sunny but mainly shaded by trees. You order from the counter and the friendly staff makes the heroic effort of finding you on the terrace to deliver your order. The menu is not spectacular but god for a snack after walking around the busy Louvre (or city) for a couple of hours.

Most dirty restaurant we have ever experienced in our entire life! After making a comment about my wine glass being dirty I got a new one that was even more dirty.. And on top of that I think they washed the cutlery in the toilet. How can you serve this? We have left this place. Waste of our time and money.
Good place for a short break while walking. We went there several times during our visit to Paris and it was always pleasant. We will certainly return again.
We were waiting more than 25 minutes to get 2 bottles of water! Unbelievable üò°

Nice food, reasonable prices, very friendly staff in a beautiful setting. Casual, order at the counter and they bring food and drinks to your table.
This is the Latte, it was worse than it looks.

Very very bad service, rude staff, extremely slow. Total waist of time and money.  I do NOT recommend.
Is it expensive, yes. But with great food and amazing environment, totally worth it

The croque Monsieur was delicious, but the homemade potato was an industrialized packet of chips. The most fun part of lunch are the birds that fearlessly approach and try to steal the food.
The coffee was fine, the price probably corresponds to the location (‚Ç¨3 in 1/2025). Unbeatable environment.
6‚Ç¨50 for a cappuccino which was disgusting. It's theft! (+ charging ‚Ç¨1 for plant-based milk is shameful) Fortunately the server was nice.

For an order of more than 44 euros it was impossible to be served even a glass of water, yet the young man alone behind us (with an order for less than 20 euros) managed to get 2. After having read old comments on this subject, it seems that management had nevertheless reminded its staff of its position on this point. I suggest that management stay put for a while to monitor their staff's attitude towards their customers instead of sitting in their offices counting their dividends. It's a shame that we can't give zero stars to the service, this deprives me of giving the real rating to this criterion. As for the food, the bagel was served frozen and we had to negotiate to have it reheated, all the more scandalous given the fact that there were no other customers waiting to order. Well, finally, I recommend that you only turn to this establishment if you can't find anything else.

Croque monsieur for my daughter and me. A lot of waiting even though there were no crowds (you need a QR code for the basin to access it). All this for a completely burnt croque monsieur, so really poor in terms of taste. With a mesclun salad served dry! And obviously 13‚Ç¨X2 for that
